Titulo: Evaluation of Ce-doped Pr2CuO4 for potential application as a cathode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: (x = 0.05; 0.1; 0.15) samples were synthesized and systematically characterized towards application as a cathode material for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Evaluation of Ce-doped Pr2CuO4 for potential application as a cathode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: High-temperature electrical conductivity, thermal expansion, and electrocatalytic activity in the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) were examined.
Titulo: Evaluation of Ce-doped Pr2CuO4 for potential application as a cathode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrical conductivity of Pr2-xCexCuO4 oxides demonstrates semiconducting behavior up to 900 degrees C. Small Ce-doping (2.5 at%) allows an increase in electrical conductivity from 100 to 130 S cm(-1) in air at 500-800 degrees C. DFT calculations revealed that the density of states directly below the Fermi level, comprised mainly of Cu 3d and O 2p states, is significantly affected by atoms in rare earth positions, which might give an indication of a correlation between calculated electronic structures and measured conducting properties.
Titulo: Evaluation of Ce-doped Pr2CuO4 for potential application as a cathode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Ce-doping in Pr2-xCexCuO4 slightly increases TEC from 11.9 x 10(-6) K-1 for x = 0 to 14.2 x 10(-6) K-1 for x = 0.15.
Titulo: Evaluation of Ce-doped Pr2CuO4 for potential application as a cathode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Substitution of 2.5% of Pr atoms in Pr2CuO4 by Ce is effective to enhance the electrochemical performance of the material as a SOFC cathode in the ORR (ASR of Pr1.95Ce0.05CuO4 electrode applied on Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 electrolyte is 0.39 Omega cm(2) at 750 degrees C in air).
Titulo: Evaluation of Ce-doped Pr2CuO4 for potential application as a cathode material for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The peak power density achieved for the electrolyte-supported fuel cell with the Pr1.95Ce0.05CuO4 cathode is 150 mW cm(-2) at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Evaluation of Ce-doped Pr2CuO4 for potential application as a cathode material for solid oxide fuel cells
